summary: The "gender inequality index," a concept redirecting to "gender equality," emphasizes the need for practical measures to redress inequalities affecting various aspects of life, including salary, maternity, and entrepreneurship. Within EU legal frameworks, this index serves as a formidable tool for assessing the advancement of gender rights and freedoms. It aims to mainstream gender considerations in policy-making and sensitization efforts, ensuring that roles and treatment of spouses and parents are equitably defined. The index also encourages the redefinition of societal attitudes towards motherhood and pregnancy, fostering a dignified environment where individuals can exercise their rights without invalidity. By diversifying approaches and endorsing microfinance initiatives, the EU seeks to further the chances of success for all genders, thereby enhancing the workings of equality across member states.
